author: gcolvin
content:
An idea: instead of a fixed-size stack, make stack growth like memory, "practically unlimited" but quadratically expensive.  So stack overflow becomes "just" another way to OOG, and recursive (or just deep) calls become less dangerous.

This a simplification of the spec in that it removes one exceptional halting state.  The PUSH gas cost does get more complex, but all stack overflow checking goes away.
